header.gameNote: SOUTHERN CONFERENCE MEN'S CHAMPIONSHIP - QUARTERFINALS AT CHATTANOOGA TN

article.headline: Samford 76, The Citadel 67
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. -- Bryan Friday scored 22 points and Trey Montgomery added 20 as Samford upset The Citadel 76-67 Saturday night in the Southern Conference tournament quarterfinals. Samford (16-15), a first-year SoCon member picked to finish sixth in the North Division, will play Chattanooga in Sunday's semifinals. Montgomery scored seven consecutive points early in the second half, capped by a three-point play with 16:43 remaining, as Samford pulled away to a 44-32 advantage. Samford, which shot 56.4 percent from the floor (22 of 39), stretched its lead to 49-34 on a Josh Davis 3-pointer with 14:57 left. The Citadel (20-12), hoping to reach the league semifinals for the first time since 1998, was eliminated in its opening game for the sixth time in seven years. Cameron Wells led The Citadel with 22 points on 9-of-18 shooting.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
